derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the general sense 'something added'): from Latin accessio(n-), from the verb accedere 'approach, come to' (see accede)

entry.tran: （君主、帝王的）登基，即位；（国家统治者的）就职，就任
entry.def: Accession is the act of taking up a position as the ruler of a country.

example.ex: ...the 50th anniversary of the Queen's accession to the throne.

entry.def: A country's accession to a group of countries or to an association is its joining that group of countries or association.

example.tran: 纳米比亚正式加入《洛美协定》

example.ex: ...a ballot over the issue of Kashmir's accession to India.
example.tran: 对克什米尔是否并入印度的表决

means.word_mean: 1. a process of increasing by addition (as to a collection or group);
2. (civil law) the right to all of that which your property produces whether by growth or improvement
3. something added to what you already have;

sentences.sentence: "he was a new addition to the staff"

means.word_mean: 4. agreeing with or consenting to (often unwillingly);

sentences.sentence: "accession to such demands would set a dangerous precedent"

means.word_mean: 6. the act of attaining or gaining access to a new office or right or position (especially the throne);
1. make a record of additions to a collection, such as a library
